com.amazon.clouddrive.model

Class PaginatedCloudDriveRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.clouddrive.model.PaginatedCloudDriveRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CloudDriveRequest, java.lang.Comparable<CloudDriveRequest>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListChildrenRequest, ListNodesInTrashRequest, ListNodesRequest

    public abstract class PaginatedCloudDriveRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements CloudDriveRequest
    Base class for requests where the response has multiple pages.

      • setFilters

        public void setFilters(java.lang.String filters)
        Filters out the list responses based on file properties. Filters are strings that define a property and value.

        Syntax Example 1:

        request.setFilters("property1:value1 AND property2:value2");

        Syntax Example 2:

        request.setFilters("property1:(value1* OR value2*) AND property3:(value3 AND value4)");

        Usage Example: To nodes which are images or videos, you can use the following filter:

        request.setFilters("contentType:(image* OR video*)");

        Parameters:
        filters - the filter string

      • getSort

        public java.lang.String getSort()
        Returns the sort string.
        Returns:
        the sort string.

      • setSort

        public void setSort(java.lang.String sort)
        Sets the sort string. Suffix the sort property with a Sort Order (ASC/DESC) separated by space. If only sort property is mentioned with out the sort order, it is defaulted to Sort Order DESC. Property and Sort Order pairs start and end with the '"' character. This must be escaped if it is a String literal in Java.

        Syntax Example:

        request.setSort("[\"property1 ASC\",\"property2 DESC\", \"property3\"]");

        Usage Example: To sort on name in ascending and size in contentProperties in descending:

        request.setSort("[\"name ASC\",\"contentProperties.size DESC\"]");

        Parameters:
        sort - the sort string
